title: Coding Agent Spec
content:
Source document: `docs/coding_agent/coding_agent_spec.md`

Spec-driven + AI automation workflow definition for a new project.

Core intent:
- Human focuses on design/judgment/review
- AI agents + Sudocode handle implementation, verification, and PR flow
- SSOT separation: intent in `.specs/`, facts in `docs/generated/`

Key structure:
- 3-layer pipeline: Spec -> Roadmap -> Sudocode Issue DAG
- Roadmap hierarchy: Gate -> Epic -> Task
- 1 Task = 1 Issue = 1 PR
- Verification ladder L0~L3 and approval policy (manual/auto)

Automation and governance:
- Sudocode orchestrates ready-issue dispatch and dependency unblocking
- Local shift-left review via Momus before PR creation
- Security guardrails include gitleaks, push protection, and CI scans
- ADR process centralizes unresolved design decisions

This spec record is imported from the source markdown and used as the requirements anchor for execution issues.

title: Coding Agent Roadmap
content:
Source document: `docs/coding_agent/coding_agent_roadmap.md`

Step-by-step execution roadmap to implement the Coding Agent Spec.

Phased plan:
- G0: prerequisite setup (repo, gh auth, gitleaks, pre-commit, Sudocode)
- G1: repository skeleton and baseline files
- G2: orchestration state setup (including spec registration in Sudocode)
- G3: local security hooks
- G4: CI/CD workflows (L2, security, drift, auto-merge, weekly report)
- G5: agent skills/templates and reporting scripts
- G6: first end-to-end dry-run and parallel dispatch validation

Execution principles:
- Human and AI responsibilities are explicitly separated
- Completion checks are defined per task
- Workflow progresses gate-by-gate with measurable checkpoints

This roadmap record is imported from the source markdown and used as execution guidance linked to implementation issues.
